meanings.definition: A substance that prevents the passage of light or sound.
meanings.sent1: The thick curtains acted as an occludent, keeping the room dark.
meanings.sent2: The wall was an effective occludent, blocking out the noise from the street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child used pillows as occludents to create a secret hideout.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was an occludent, muffling the chaos around her.
meanings.sent5: The blackout blinds were the perfect occludent, ensuring complete darkness in the room.

meanings.definition: A dental device that prevents teeth from coming into contact with each other.
meanings.sent1: The dentist recommended a night guard as an occludent to protect the teeth.
meanings.sent2: The occludent helped prevent grinding of the teeth during sleep.
meanings.sent3: The tooth fairy left a tiny occludent to keep the teeth from touching at night.
meanings.sent4: The dental occludent was like a shield, guarding the teeth from damage.
meanings.sent5: The custom-made occludent fit perfectly, ensuring no contact between the teeth.

meanings.definition: A muscle that closes a body opening.
meanings.sent1: The sphincter muscle acted as an occludent, sealing the digestive tract.
meanings.sent2: The occludent muscle prevented any leakage from the bladder.
meanings.sent3: The hiccup was caused by the occludent muscle twitching unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The occludent muscle was like a gatekeeper, controlling the flow of fluids.
meanings.sent5: The strong occludent muscle ensured no air escaped during the breath-holding contest.
